comment.author: 16830149@N02
comment._content:
From the CWCG:
Name: HICKOX, EDWIN BASKERVILLE 
Initials: E B 
Nationality: United Kingdom 
Rank: Major 
Regiment/Service: Essex Regiment 
Unit Text: 9th Bn. 
Age: 28 
Date of Death: 15/08/1917 
Awards: M C 
Additional information: Son of Elizabeth Hickox, of 72, Wray Crescent, Tollington Park, London, and the late Edwin William Hickox. Native of Finsbury Park, London. 
Casualty Type: Commonwealth War Dead 
Grave/Memorial Reference: VI. B. 53. 
Cemetery: DUISANS BRITISH CEMETERY, ETRUN 
Medal Card:
Entered France 30.5.1915

comment.author: 63191264@N00
comment._content:
Born on the 9th September 1888 the only son of Edwin William Hickox [b.1858, Bow, London. d.22/10/1921] and Elizabeth nee Mason [b.1866 Hull, East Yorks. d.1950]. The 1891 census records him living at 288 Seven Sisters Road, Finsbury Park, London  with his parents and two sisters Evelyn Mary [b.1866] and Elsie Charlotte [b1891] and a domestic servant.
The 1901 and the 1911 census' record the family still at the same address. In both census’ his father’s occupation is recorded as “Stationer” with the addition of “Book Seller” in the 1901 edition. In the 1911 Census, Edwin's occupation is recorded as "Incorporated Accountant". 
The premises still exist although now a branch of “Kentucky Fried Chicken”. Presumably they were living “above the shop”.
The family are then recorded [as shayes2006 notes in his post] living at 72 Wray Crescent, Tollington Park, Islington. This is verified by the 1914 Post Office Directory. The area was bombed during WW2 and this resulted in the demolition of the address, now the site of a public park.
By 1915, Edwin Baskerville Hickox is recorded in the Post Office Directory as an accountant with his own firm of E. Baskerville Hickox at 57 Bow Churchyard, Cheapside, London. Quite a prestigious area to have an office.
The National Probate Calendar [Index of Wills & Administrations] for September 1917 records;
HICKOX Edwin Baskerville of 72 Wray Crescent, Tollington Park, Middlesex MC Major 9th Essex Regiment died 15th August 1917 in Frnce. Adminstration London 28th September to Edwin William Hickox of independent means, Effects £430 14s 2d.
The National Probate Calendar [Index of Wills & Administrations] for October 1917 records;
HICKOX Edwin Baskerville of 72 Wray Crescent, Tollington Park, Middlesex, Major 9th Essex Reg. Died 15th August 1917 in France. London 15th October to Elizabeth Hickox (widow) and Evelyn Mary Hickox (spinster) effects £156  5s. [Former grant in September 1917]
Below is a thumbnail pic of his home in Wray Crescent, Tollington Park. Click on it for a bigger version.
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/liits/6511337671/in/photostream]

comment.author: 90349480@N06
comment._content: Edwin Baskerville Hickox died in August 1917 at a casualty clearing station as the result of a grenade accident.  Prior to the war he had placed first in the 1909 examination by the Incorporated Society of Accountants.  Also, prior to the war he was a captain and adjutant of the North London Division of the Church Lads’ Brigade.  He was a member of the North London Chess Club and, as an amateur magician, was a member of The Magic Circle, an association of magicians founded in London in 1909.
